sentences.chinese: 恰似太阳在我心里放射。

sentences.english: It ran like a streak, just a blur of black.
sentences.chinese: 它奔驰如电，恰似一道朦胧的黑影。

sentences.english: The cracked bed of Lake Eyre, meantime, resembles nothing so much as a lunar landscape.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔湖破裂的河床，恰似月球表面的景象。

sentences.english: This is my beautiful home, like the sky world.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我美丽的家乡，恰似天上人间。

sentences.english: Just see the overbrimming river flowing east!
sentences.chinese: 恰似一江春水向东流句号。

sentences.english: It came as a joyous daybreak to end the long light of captivity.
sentences.chinese: 恰似结束漫漫长夜禁锢的欢畅黎明。

sentences.english: My prime of youth is but a frost of cares.
sentences.chinese: 我的青春恰似一层薄霜。

sentences.english: The Eight Trigrams are a set of symbolic signs created in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: “八卦”恰似中国现代发明的一套有意味意思的标记。

sentences.english: Race relations in the US continue to be a thorny problem.
sentences.chinese: 对于美国来说，一直以来，种族关系恰似如鲠在喉。

sentences.english: Red and yellow glaze, natural glaze line, like the Han Xue.
sentences.chinese: 通体施黄红釉，釉线自然，恰似汗血。

sentences.english: The birds of night peck at the first stars, that flash like my soule when I love you.
sentences.chinese: 夜鸟啄食初现的群星，群星闪烁恰似深爱你的魂灵。

sentences.english: She took the new blanket out of the wardrobe and shook it out.
sentences.chinese: 好恰似衣柜里拿出新毯子把它抖开。

sentences.english: But in this paper, sketch expression is thought a pas de Deux of sensibility and rationality.
sentences.chinese: 但本文认为素描表现恰似一曲感性与理性的双人舞。

sentences.english: Like the tide, shadows flow towards the shore of light.
sentences.chinese: 暗影涌动，恰似潮汐，奔向光之海岸。

sentences.english: "Human bodies are just a machine, " he says.

definition: to be as if.../to be rather like...
variant of 彷彿|仿佛[fang3 fu2]
(literary) to be exactly like/to be exactly as if
